Author: Mark R. Levin
Description: The Fox News host gives his take on the Green New Deal, critical race theory and social activism.

Author: Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporters examine Trump’s final year in office, with a focus on the key players around him.

Author: Michael Wolff
Description: The author of “Fire and Fury” and “Siege” portrays events during the final days of Trump’s presidency.

Author: Jesse Watters
Description: The Fox News host recounts his career and prescribes ways to defend against what he considers left-wing radicalism.

Book Title: THIS IS YOUR MIND ON PLANTS
Author: Michael Pollan
Description: A look at arbitrary beliefs surrounding opium, caffeine and mescaline, which are derived from plants.

Author: Matthew McConaughe
Description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.

Author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfre
Description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.

Author: Glennon Doyle
Description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

Author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
Description: The 10th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series looks at organized crime in the United States during the 20th century.

Book Title: FRANKLY, WE DID WIN THIS ELECTION
Author: Michael C. Bender
Description: A senior White House reporter for The Wall Street Journal looks at Trump’s 2020 campaign and final year in office.

Author: Michelle Zauner
Description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

Author: Malcolm Gladwell
Description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.

Author: Adam Grant
Description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

Author: John Green
Description: A collection of personal essays that review different facets of the human-centered planet.
